Larry has a cat that foals around outside and waking up to go to work to see a little cat rub up against your leg made it feel so much more blissful. The parking was spacious and perfectly placed under shelter. It rained so hard and nothing was wet: the car, the porch, the door or stairsâ€” everything has been built to a good standard and the entire trip made me feel like a was home away from home and it was only 95 miles away from the beach! You HAVE to stay here, you will NOT regret it, I promise you!

The kitchen has all you need--(besides the dishes, pans and flatware,) a stove, microwave, toaster oven, k-cup coffeemaker and a full size fridge with an icemaker. The queen bed is in great shape. We didn't need to use the washer or dryer, but they are full size too!
The apartment is on the second floor, and the owner has installed a cargo (cargo, not people) lift, so you don't have to carry your stuff up the stairs. It's a quiet neighborhood and the owner is very attentive; he communicated a lot and checked in to see if we needed anything.
If we ever get back to Enterprise, we will definitely want to stay here!

The apartment has a dual zone heating and air conditioning system with remotes so you can change the temperature from the bed and in the living room/kitchen. The washer and dryer are located in the bedroom closet which was super nice. The bbq grill was nice and we cooked out twice during our week stay. We really enjoyed the freight lift and used it bringing our luggage and other stuff for the week up to the apartment. The apartment is nice and quiet and Larry's place is located on a street that dead ends so there isn't much traffic or noise. You have pretty much anything you could possibly need here with a fully furnished kitchen, regular coffee pot, Keurig style coffee pot, fridge with icemaker, electric range and even a dishwasher. We had a very comfortable and pleasant stay and would highly recommend it!

name: Chris
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
January 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We travel a lot, and I've entered many Airbnb. I long to be able to enter then relax. Unfortunately, because of my work in the construction industry, my eye for detail and workmanship keeps me from just being. I tend to see everything(bad). I'm sure its mental. Entering this home gave me a unique opportunity to both relax and respect great workmanship. Everything from the rustic log cabin interior to the floor elevation change in the kitchen just so a set of stairs wouldn't look out of place reaching the second-floor kid's loft. Trimming every nook and softening every angle. Knock down ceilings with a flawless 45-degree corner bead. Little lanterns hardwired for accent lighting. Ductless splits installed level and tight to the wall. As one old timer told me years ago. "If you have no pride in what you're doing, you'll have no shame in doing it poorly.". This home is unique in that way, (forgiving the tile, lol) and it was a pleasure to stay in. Quiet, cozy and relaxing. Thanks again!.

The rustic feel and the amenities provided made for a memorable and comfortable stay. The first thing that struck me about the Airbnb was the warm and inviting ambiance. The rustic decor was tastefully done and added to the place's charm. It truly felt like a home away from home.
The amenities provided were top-notch and everything a guest could need was available. The kitchen was well-stocked with all the necessary utensils and appliances, making cooking and preparing meals easy. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of towels and toiletries.
The bed was comfortable and cozy, and I slept soundly throughout my stay. The linens were soft and luxurious, adding to the overall comfort of the space. One of the things that stood out to me was the attention to detail. Everything was thoughtfully arranged and the small touches really added to the overall experience.
Overall, my stay at this charming Airbnb was truly exceptional.

Not just timely communications but everything was followed up with another note. A question we had was replied to within 30 minutes. We really felt that anything we needed would be accommodated if possible. Third is location: if you are there to access Fort Rucker you are less than 5 minutes to one of the gates. We were there for our sonâ€™s graduation from flight school and this was PERFECT. Plus we were closer to downtown Enterprise which was nice since itâ€™s such a quaint town. We HIGHLY recommend Sylviaâ€™s AirBNB!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We booked Christy's place and it turned out to be a fantastic stay. We were visiting family in the area and looked for a place that was close to Fort Novosel. Christy's place was a perfect place as a daily launching place for our visit. The suite was only minutes from the base, was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The kitchenette worked well for us as we only had a quick breakfast in the morning and didn't return to the suite until much later in the evening. The suite is spacious and my wife and the bedroom privacy is ensured with a door separating the bedroom from the rest of the suite. Plenty of room for two, we really enjoyed the stay and look forward to booking again for our next visit to the area.
Christy is truly a Superhost! It is obvious that she takes pride in her suite and cares for those who choose to stay here. Great communications, easy check-in and check-out and very respectful of privacy, I wish that I could give more than 5 stars for Christy. Thanks!

Â·

review_text: Christy was an amazing host. There was a fan (white noise machine) and an AC unit in case it got warm. Which I always sleep with a fan so it was nice to have the noise. I had an overnight flight and they were generous enough to let me check in earlier. I slept great free of distractions. I loved the extra light at the mirror in the bathroom to help get ready. It was only 5 minutes from Ft Rucker. They had a bookshelf with some books, that if I had time, I would have enjoyed to read. I also love how the couch/loveseat rocked. If I ever go back to Dothan I will definitely request to stay here. Oh and another bonus is they let you park under the carport right next to the door. They even had a diffuser which I use essential oils daily so having that option was amazing to be able to make it feel more like home.

The house and furnishings were immaculate and tasteful. The home has a supply of games and activities for kids and families. The neighborhood was very walkable and clean. If you're looking for a comfortable, homey place to stay near Fort Rucker, Downtown Enterprise, and restaurants and shops, then this is Airbnb is the perfect choice.
The home itself is beautifully decorated and has a cozy, inviting atmosphere. You'll feel right at home from the moment you step inside. The screened in porch was lovely and inviting. A great place to relax at the end of the day. The beds were comfortable and the home was well stocked with all of the essentials. I especially appreciated the full size hair dryer!
From the moment I made my booking, the host was quick to respond to my messages and answer any questions. Throughout my stay, the host remained accessible and responsive. This level of attentiveness made my stay all the more comfortable and stress-free.
Overall, this Airbnb is an excellent choice for anyone visiting Fort Rucker or the Enterprise area. With its prime location, cozy atmosphere, and high-tech amenities, it truly feels like a home away from home.

I will continue to be a regular.

April 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We enjoyed our stay here. The beds were very comfortable. I have an over sensitive sense of smell so very often the most objectionable thing about a place will be its smell. There were some air fresheners, but they were mild so I didn't mind too much. The next door neighbor was burning trash when we first showed up. The smell hadn't gotten into the house by that time and we kept the doors shut as much as we could to keep it out, but by the middle of the night it had made its way into the house somewhat. It was still smoldering the next morning so I contacted the host about it and she responded quickly and said that the authorities were on their way. I guess whatever she did worked because the fires were out when we came back that night and we didn't have any more issue with that. It was really more space than we needed, so if we come back to the area I might choose a smaller cheaper place if one is available, but if not I'd be more than happy to stay here again. Thanks for having us.

Sharolyn's place is fantastic! She was able to accommodate my same day booking due to hurricane evacuation.
The house is very quiet and perfect for someone who works or is a light sleeper. The house is sparkling clean and has a full kitchen. Check in is very easy, all doors have codes and it is very easy to figure out. The house is around 15 minutes drive to the town center where you can find grocery and food. Overall my stay was wonderful and I would absolutely stay again. Thank you Sharolyn!

name: Joseph
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2019
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I am a repeat guest at Sharolyn''s place. The last time I stayed in The Cozy Corner room. The Lake Room and Sharolyn's whole place is clean! As in "Crazy "wear sunglasses" clean". No cats or other pets (except fish in the foyer aquarium).
Organized! Over the top organized! Everything is labeled so you know what is available to you and what any rules about it are. Very reassuring! I never had to ask about anything!
The inside environment was very quiet. The neighborhood is excellent and in the country. There was ample onsite parking.
The bed had a perfect, high quality, medium-soft mattress. I slept very well. Had control of a ceiling fan. The bedroom has a pin-pad lock.
I shared a bathroom with another room but almost didn't see another soul. Bathroom was sparkling clean and stocked with shampoos and soaps. A fluffy towel, hand towel, and washcloth were provided in my bedroom.
I didn't use the common kitchen except for a cup of complimentary Keurig coffee. However, every single cabinet was labeled with its contents for our use. Also, there was designated cabinet storage space in the kitchen labeled for each. The very reasonable usage rules were posted clearly too.
Love this host and home.
